Julian Brandt's father and agent has denied that any deal has been agreed for his son to join Bayern Munich this summer.

Bild reported on Friday that Brandt had made a verbal agreement with Bayern in what would be a €30m deal should it take place this summer, or €12.5m in 2018 thanks to a release-clause.

"There isn't any trend nor any agreement," said Jurgen, Julian's father, speaking to Sky Germany.

"Julian will speak to Leverkusen about the season and his future in the summer.

"There have been enquiries from Bayern as well as others - but only to me. I collect these but there's nothing concrete yet.

"Julian hasn't made any decision as to his future yet. He hasn't spoken with any of those responsible at Bayern such as [Karl-Heinz] Rummenigge, [Uli] Hoeness or [Michael] Reschke, nor has he spoken to [Carlo] Ancelotti."

Monchi has reiterated he ‘likes’ the idea of moving to Roma but has confirmed he has also spoken to clubs in England and France.

The Sevilla sporting director confirmed he was leaving the Andalucians at the end of the season but has ruled out the possibility of joining another Spanish clubs after Marca linked him to Real Madrid.

"Roma are the team that has talked to me the most and I like the proposal,” told El Larguero.

“They want to wait for me but there are other offers in France and England, although they are not so far along. I have listened to them and I told them how I work, but again Roma is a project I like.

“There are three types (of sporting director), as I see it. There is a presidentialist - where the president is the boss. Another, as in the English Premier League, where the coach is the manager who passes plans on to the sporting director and another is a mixed model like Sevilla - the president sets the tone, but I have a lot of responsibility and say.

“I couldn’t go to another Spanish club – I am a Sevillista. One of the elements I am most proud is the structure of the club I will leave behind, it is in very good shape.”

Monchi has reiterated he ‘likes’ the idea of moving to Roma but has confirmed he has also spoken to clubs in England and France.

The Sevilla sporting director confirmed he was leaving the Andalucians at the end of the season but has ruled out the possibility of joining another Spanish clubs after Marca linked him to Real Madrid.

"Roma are the team that has talked to me the most and I like the proposal,” told El Larguero.

“They want to wait for me but there are other offers in France and England, although they are not so far along. I have listened to them and I told them how I work, but again Roma is a project I like.

“There are three types (of sporting director), as I see it. There is a presidentialist - where the president is the boss. Another, as in the English Premier League, where the coach is the manager who passes plans on to the sporting director and another is a mixed model like Sevilla - the president sets the tone, but I have a lot of responsibility and say.

“I couldn’t go to another Spanish club – I am a Sevillista. One of the elements I am most proud is the structure of the club I will leave behind, it is in very good shape.”

Liverpool are interested in signing Real Madrid attacker James Rodriguez according to Sky Sports​ journalist Guillem Balague.

Asked if Liverpool are keen in the 25-year-old, Balague said:

"Of course they are, but they aren't the only one. Liverpool are realistic and I think they realise James is looking for a different type of team."

"But he is leaving the door open to all possibilities because he knows Real Madrid want to get rid of him. He would like to go to a club like Chelsea or Manchester United and he has offers from England and Italy but we will have to wait and see."
​
​Liverpool have been linked with a move for Rodriguez who is set to leave Real Madrid at the end of the season.
​
​Although he is the type of signing Liverpool fans want it would be very hard to see where he'd fit in the front three with Coutinho, Firmino and Mane nailed on to start when fit.

Jurgen Klopp says Liverpool will prove they have learned from this season when they enter the transfer market to strengthen the squad.

It promises to be a busy summer with Klopp promised significant funds to ensure the Reds are able to cope with the added demands of European football.

“We will show that we have learned from this year,” Klopp said.

“Of course we will bring in players. Of course the squad will change in a few positions. We will still have young players in the squad.

“With the problems we had in January and February, the injury to Phil (Coutinho) in November, Sadio (Mane) away in January, Danny Ings not in for a long time, Daniel Sturridge not 100% and then out....

“Each team in the world would miss them. Should we have bought another winger? Another striker?

“Yes, it felt like this in these moments but it gave young boys the oppoortunity to show themselves.

“But next year with more games we need to have more options in these positions.”

Klopp: "Trent is a wonderful player. We are really happy to have him here. The international break for him was really intense - did a lot."

Klopp: "He has to improve in defence from the full-back position, but with his speed he can play a little bit higher up & defend too."

Klopp: "We are really happy to have him. We need all players in this last part of the season, and he is one of these players."

Klopp is prepared to abandon idealism & ‘win ugly’ to secure the Champions League following the injury to Sadio Mané. (Chris Bascombe)

Origi is expected to face Bournemouth although @trentaa98 is also in contention & Klopp also hinted at a formation change. (Chris Bascombe)

Klopp: "The line-up we will choose is to make them as strong, as compact and as ugly to play as possible."

Klopp has Daniel Sturridge back training although he is not expected to be in contention for selection until the weekend. (Chris Bascombe)
